intro: Nematolepis, commonly known as the needle grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit, often forming dense mats or tufts. The plants typically have small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered along the stems. Nematolepis species are native to various regions in Australia and are often found in dry, sandy or rocky soils. These plants are well adapted to arid environments and play a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small organisms.
